\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1file_adf7e73537e98788dd40ddf806d3b55be}{}\index{chaos\+::file@{chaos\+::file}!exists@{exists}}
\index{exists@{exists}!chaos\+::file@{chaos\+::file}}
\subsubsection[{exists(const chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}bool chaos\+::file\+::exists (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1file_adf7e73537e98788dd40ddf806d3b55be}


Checks whether the given path exists on disk. 

This check does not include the type of the path, i.\+e. it can be a directory, file, symbolic link, etc.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em path} & The path to check for existence. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Returns True if the path exists, false otherwise. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

\end{DoxyParamCaption}

Returns whether the given path is a directory. 

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
If the path does not exist this operation will return false. 
\end{DoxyNote}

\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1file_aea03a5eedcd2c4039bbc25d57eed4f8b}{}\index{chaos\+::file@{chaos\+::file}!validate\+Path@{validate\+Path}}
\index{validate\+Path@{validate\+Path}!chaos\+::file@{chaos\+::file}}
\subsubsection[{validate\+Path(const chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\+::file\+::validate\+Path (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1file_aea03a5eedcd2c4039bbc25d57eed4f8b}


Attempts to directories to the given path if they don\textquotesingle{}t exist. 

This operation will ensure that the given path is available for writing. For example, providing the path\+: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
\textcolor{stringliteral}{"example/path/to/file.txt"}
\end{DoxyCode}
 Will attempt ensure the this directory structure exists\+: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
\textcolor{stringliteral}{"example/path/to/}
\end{DoxyCode}
 If the path ends with a \textquotesingle{}/\textquotesingle{} (or \textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}\textquotesingle{} only on Windows) the entire path will be validated. For example, providing the path\+: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
\textcolor{stringliteral}{"example/path/to/directory/"}
\end{DoxyCode}
 Will attempt to ensure that the entire path exists.
